page.title: 08Wetton Nature Trail & Caves
page.content: Old Hannah's Cave looks at you from above, the river flows down towards the ford where the Hoo Brook joins the Manifold. When you go along the track to the Wetton-Butterton road you go straight on across the road and keep going down the winding valley. To your right is Ladyside Wood and to your left is Thor's Cave. {The Wetton Caves} Old Hannah's cave is at Wetton Mill. Bones, pottery and bone tools were recently found there. The next cave southwards is called Ossom's Cave built into Ossom's Hill. Thor's Cave was examined by Carrington, a Wetton schoolmaster, who found some relics which were sent to the British Museum. Beeston Tor Cave goes back into a massive rock face. In the 1920s Rev.G.H.Wilson found Saxon coins and jewelry there. Some of the finds are in Hanley Museum.
